Title: Project Template
Short Summary: This is a template to get started on projects.
Long Summary: To get started clone this template then modify the title, tags, and summaries
to match the project. Actual html code sould work fine when used in here, the
code replaces the innerHTML of the article.

Content: Great place for placing the notes assoicated with this project!
This should be a link!
Need a section with out a header, just remove the header!
Great place for placing the the links to the blogs assoicated with this project!
This should be a link!
The col-* tags are how you can split this into seperate sections side by side.
Use col-12 for a single section, col-6 for half sections, col-rounded(12/num) for
different splits. Use a new setion for wider spaced paragraphs.
Project Goals: What problem was this project trying to solve? What were
the desired outcomes?
Include things like: Client/Company, Timeline/Duration, Tools & Technology, Your Role.
Client or Company: Mention the client or company you worked with.
Timeline/Duration: Indicate the project's start and end dates or the length of

time it took.</p
>
Your Role: Clearly define your responsibilities and contributions.
Tools and Technologies: List the software, programming languages, frameworks or
other tools you used

Context, Problem Statement, Research & Planning

Context: Explain the context of the project and the challenges you faced.

Problem Statement: Clearly articculate the problem or need that the project addressed.

Research and Planning: Briefly describe any research or panning you conducted.
Design Process (if applicable), Development Process (if applicable), Itterations & Feedback
Design Process: Showcase your design thinking, wireframes, mockups, or prototypes.
Explain your design decisions and rationale.
Development Process: Dscribe your development approach, any technical challenges you
overcame, and how you implemented the solution. Include code snippets (if appropraite) or links
to repositories.
Itterations and Feedback: Mention any itterations or revisions you made based on feedback.

Outcomes, Metrics & Data, User Feedback/Testimonials, Lessons Learned

Outcomes: Highlight the positives outcomes of the project.

Metrics and Data: If possible, quantify the results with data or metrics.

User Feedback/Testimonials: Include positive feedback or testimonials from clients or users.

Lessons Learned: Reflect on what you learned from teh project and how it has improved your skills.
